cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTYS GOVERNMENTThe circulation of this paper has been strictly limited.It is issued for the personal use of.MOST SECRET. Copy No. CONFIDENTIAL ANNEX' -W.M.-(iUt)l2TH CONCLUSIONS. MINUTE 1(27th January, 19kh at 12.15 p0rn0)POLAND- At their previous meeting, theWar Cabinet had agreed on the lines on which(Previous Reference: the Prime Minister should make an approachW.M.(hlOllth to Marshal Stalin and the Prime MinisterConclusions, had undertaken to prepare a draftDMinute 1) -The Prime Minister's draft was read to the War Cabinet. Certain amendments sub-mi tted by the Foreign Secretary "were'discussed and agreed to.The War Cabinet?s conclusions were as "follows:(l) The draft message, as amended in discussion, should be despatched,,(2) The Polish Ministers had asked if .they could see the text:.of the message. They should be told that theftvfcie Ministers message was we31 within theambit of the conversations, whichhad taken place with them, but thatas it took the form of a.personal message from the Prime Minister to premier Stalin, it was not altogether suitable to communicate to them.(3) The Secretary of State for DominionAffairs was authorised to send theDominion Prime Ministers, for their personal information', a.summary of the: . \ conversation between the PrimeMinister and the Polish Ministers on20th' January, together with the text of the telegram to Marshal Stalin,as despatched,,Offices of the War Cabinet,S.W.1,
